item.title: Pimco 的伊瓦辛拥抱特朗普驱动的债券市场波动
item.description: 太平洋投资管理公司的首席投资官表示，债券交易员无法预测美国总统唐纳德-特朗普接下来会做什么，但可以利用这种不确定性来创造丰厚的回报。【原文：Bond traders can’t predict what US President Donald Trump will do next, but that uncertainty can be exploited to generate strong returns, according to Pacific Investment Management Co.’s chief investment officer.】

item.title: 微策略公司在财报发布前将公司名称改为策略公司
item.description: 一直在利用资本市场为购买比特币提供资金的软件制造商微策略公司（MicroStrategy Inc.【原文：MicroStrategy Inc., the software maker that has been tapping capital markets to fund purchases of Bitcoin, announced on Wednesday that the company would now be doing business under the name Strategy.】

item.title: 关税动荡下金商大幅折价出售京东方金条
item.description: 由于对特朗普可能征收关税的担忧引发了对金银的争夺，导致提取黄金的队伍排了数周之久，因此英格兰银行金库中的黄金交易价格较市场价格有所折让。【原文：Gold in the Bank of England vault is trading at a discount to the wider market, as fears over potential Trump tariffs spark a scramble for bullion that’s resulting in weeks-long queues to withdraw metal.】

item.title: 围绕特朗普关税威胁的 "有毒 "不确定性
item.description:
在本期特朗普经济学中， 我们将讨论为什么共和党贸易战略的未解之谜 可能会对全球经济造成重大损害。【原文：

On this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss why unanswered questions about the Republican’s trade strategy may do significant damage to the global economy.

】

item.title: 中东原油飙升，沙特阿美提升亚洲油价
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯将其运往亚洲的旗舰原油价格提高了两年多来最高的一次，以应对中东原油溢价的飙升和炼油厂利润的改善。【原文：Saudi Arabia hiked the price of its flagship crude to Asia by the most in more than two years as the kingdom responds to surging premiums for Middle Eastern crude and improving refinery margins.】

item.title: 盖蒂图片公司需要尽快获得 10 亿美元现金，摩根大通因此发挥创意
item.description: 盖蒂图片控股公司（Getty Images Holdings Inc.【原文：A multitude of obstacles stand in the way of Getty Images Holdings Inc. and its need for just over $1 billion of funds.】

item.title: 英伟达跳槽超微，称基于黑well的系统已准备就绪
item.description: 英伟达™（Nvidia）公司的股票周三上涨，因为其重要合作伙伴超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer Inc.【原文：Shares of Nvidia Corp. gained on Wednesday after a key partner, Super Micro Computer Inc., said its new AI data center systems powered by Nvidia’s advanced Blackwell chips are now ready to ship.】

item.title: 加拿大连裤袜制造商因贸易战困境裁员 40
item.description: 美国关税的威胁导致蒙特利尔一家女装生产商安排三分之一以上的工人休假。【原文：The threat of US tariffs has caused a Montreal-based women’s clothing maker to place more than a third of its workers on leave.】

item.title: Telegram 极端分子发表反移民言论，威胁采取行动
item.description:
仇恨组织抓住驱逐出境的新闻不放。【原文：

Hate groups are seizing on deportation news.

】

item.title: 公司正在达到推高价格的极限
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 俄罗斯紧缩政策暂无减缓通胀迹象
item.description: 在俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）大举入侵乌克兰之际，俄罗斯中央银行正准备讨论创纪录的高利率问题，而俄罗斯的物价增长几乎没有明显放缓的迹象。【原文：Russian price growth is showing little sign of a significant slowdown as the central bank prepares to discuss record-high interest rates amid massive government spending on President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.】

item.title: 贝莱德将在欧洲上市比特币交易所交易产品
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc., the world’s largest asset manager, is preparing to list an exchange-traded product tied directly to Bitcoin in Europe, following on from the success of its $58 billion US ETF tracking the cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 英国债券交易接近 2018 年里程碑，动荡局势助长交易活动
item.description: 由于今年的波动性吸引了风险寻求者重返市场，英国政府债券期货的兴趣正在蓬勃发展。【原文：Interest in UK government bond futures is booming, as this year’s volatility attracts risk seekers back to the market.】

item.title: 订单增速回落，美国服务业指数降温
item.description: 今年年初，美国服务供应商的增长有所放缓，订单量降至七个月来的最低点，表明经济中最大的服务供应商略微失去了增长势头。【原文：Growth at US service providers softened at the start of the year as a measure of orders fell to a seven-month low, indicating a slight loss of momentum in the largest part of the economy.】

item.title: 多伦多房屋新挂牌量因押注利率下调而激增 26
item.description: 上个月，多伦多待售房屋数量激增，因为卖家打赌利率下降将使买家重返市场。【原文：The number of homes put up for sale in Toronto surged last month as sellers wager that falling interest rates will bring buyers back into the market.】

item.title: 德国商业银行成立新的财富管理部门以提高收费水平
item.description: 德国商业银行（Commerzbank AG）首席执行官贝蒂娜-奥洛普（Bettina Orlopp）正在改革该银行迎合富人需求的方式，以提高手续费收入，同时她也在努力抵御意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）的潜在收购。【原文：Commerzbank AG Chief Executive Officer Bettina Orlopp is revamping how the lender caters to the rich in a push to boost fee income as she seeks to fend up a potential takeover by UniCredit SpA.】

item.title: 尽管贸易关系紧张，NexGen 仍接近达成向美国公用事业公司出售铀的协议
item.description: 加拿大 NexGen 能源有限公司称，尽管邻国之间的贸易紧张局势不断升级，但该公司正与美国几家核电公司进行深入谈判，以出售更多来自其计划在萨斯喀彻温省建造的价值 16 亿美元的铀矿的铀。【原文：Canada’s NexGen Energy Ltd. says it’s in advanced talks with several US nuclear utilities to sell more uranium from a $1.6 billion mine it plans to build in Saskatchewan despite escalating trade tensions between the neighboring nations.】

item.title: 先锋集团创纪录地削减收费，令竞争对手贝莱德和 Invesco 陷入困境
item.description: 先锋集团公司（Vanguard Group Inc.跟风，可能会损失数亿美元的收入；或者坚守阵地，冒着失去急需的市场份额的风险。【原文：Vanguard Group Inc.’s biggest salvo yet in its campaign to cut fees for the investing masses presents industry rivals with a painful choice. Follow suit and lose potentially hundreds of millions in revenue — or hold the line and risk losing badly needed market share.】

item.title: 波兰发行美元债券，再掀地区外汇债务热潮
item.description: 波兰在数月内第二次重返国际市场，出售美元债券，以满足创纪录的融资需求。【原文：Poland is returning to international markets for a second time in as many months, selling dollar-denominated bonds as part of efforts to cover record financing needs.】

item.title: 工会请求法院阻止财政部将数据提供给马斯克的数字政府办公室
item.description: 一群工会要求法院下达临时命令，阻止美国财政部将美国人的个人和财务数据交给与埃隆-马斯克的政府效率执行团队有关的人员。【原文：A group of unions asked for a temporary court order to stop the US Treasury Department from handing over personal and financial data on Americans to people associated with Elon Musk’s team of government efficiency enforcers.】

item.title: 肯尼亚中央银行连续第四次下调关键利率
item.description: 肯尼亚中央银行连续第四次下调基准利率，因为通胀率稳定在目标区间的下限。【原文：Kenya’s central bank cut the benchmark interest rate for the fourth time in a row as inflation sits comfortably at the lower end of its target band.】

item.title: 土耳其加入新兴市场债券热潮，2025 年首次出售美元债券
item.description: 在新兴市场债务销售繁忙的一周里，土耳其政府正寻求锁定低借贷成本，出售本年度第一笔美元债券。【原文：Turkey is selling its first dollar-denominated bond of the year as the government seeks to lock in low borrowing costs in a busy week for emerging-market debt sales.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长莱恩表示，在通胀风险面前需要灵活的利率政策
item.description: 欧洲中央银行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩（Philip Lane）认为，由于通胀风险仍然双向存在，欧洲中央银行应继续灵活制定货币政策。【原文：The European Central Bank should remain agile in setting monetary policy since inflation risks remain in both directions, according to Chief Economist Philip Lane.】

item.title: 南非联合政府消除分歧
item.description: 南非执政联盟的两个主要成员经过几个月的内讧之后，似乎又回到了正轨。【原文：South Africa’s ruling coalition appears to be back on track after months of infighting between its two main members.】

item.title: 麦格理关闭美国债务资本市场，转向私人信贷业务
item.description: 据知情人士透露，麦格理集团（Macquarie Group Ltd.）正在关闭其美国债务资本市场部门，该部门的业务包括杠杆贷款发放、银团贷款和交易，将把资源集中用于私人信贷。【原文：Macquarie Group Ltd. is shuttering its US debt capital markets arm, a business that includes leveraged loan origination, syndication and trading, to focus resources on private credit, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 雪佛龙正就委内瑞拉问题与特朗普政府接触
item.description: 雪佛龙公司正在与特朗普政府沟通，因为一些共和党人呼吁美国吊销该公司在委内瑞拉的经营许可证。【原文：Chevron Corp. is in communication with the Trump administration as some Republicans call for the US to revoke the company’s license to operate in Venezuela.】

item.title: 亚马逊的臃肿之战疏远了工人，取悦了华尔街
item.description:
在重返办公室政策更加普遍、技术就业市场逐渐降温的背景下，劳动力重组运动正大行其道。【原文：

Campaign to restructure workforce is capitalizing on a moment when return-to-office policies are more common and the technology job market is cooling off.

】

item.title: 俄罗斯人寻求保护储蓄，推动黄金购买量创历史新高
item.description: 俄罗斯人去年购买了创纪录数量的黄金，因为他们试图在制裁中保护自己的储蓄，购买量相当于该国年产量的四分之一。【原文：Russians bought a record amount of gold last year as they sought to protect their savings amid sanctions, obtaining the equivalent of about a fourth of the country’s annual output.】

item.title: 特朗普上任前美国贸易赤字膨胀，关税承诺掷地有声
item.description: 2024 年底，美国贸易赤字急剧扩大，原因是唐纳德-特朗普开始第二任总统任期前进口激增，以及他兑现了全面征收关税的承诺。【原文：The US trade deficit widened sharply at the end of 2024 on a surge in imports prior to the start of Donald Trump’s second term as president and his follow-through on the promise of sweeping tariffs.】

item.title: 加拿大与美国的石油贸易顺差创 2022 年以来新高
item.description: 去年年底，加拿大对美国的能源出口猛增，使加拿大对其最大客户的贸易顺差达到两年多来的最高点。【原文：Canada’s energy exports to the US jumped at the end of last year, pushing the country’s trade surplus with its biggest customer to the highest in more than two years.】
